triples.name: Social preferences
triples.relevance: The paper reviews this foundational concept explaining unselfish behavior through care for others' monetary payoffs.

triples.name: Cooperation
triples.relevance: One of the key types of unselfish behavior examined as explained by moral preferences rather than social preferences.

triples.name: Altruism
triples.relevance: A central unselfish behavior discussed as better explained by moral preferences and personal norms.

triples.name: Honesty
triples.relevance: Truth-telling is identified as a type of unselfish behavior studied within the moral preferences framework.

triples.name: Strong reciprocity
triples.relevance: The paper discusses altruistic punishment, a component of strong reciprocity, as explained by moral preferences.

triples.name: Trust (social science)
triples.relevance: Trustworthiness is identified as a type of unselfish behavior better explained by moral preferences.

triples.name: Morality
triples.relevance: The paper outlines mathematical foundations for moral preferences as the core explanatory framework for unselfish behavior.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper discusses applications of moral preference research to help AI better navigate and understand human morality.
